Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Great Stuff & Very Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Katja K
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location - short walk away from the Grand Bazaar and Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque - they were only five minutes away (if you walk really slowly 10 minutes) from the hotel. The stuff was very friendly and helpfull during the whole stay. The service aims to help you with any problem or wish. We dont feel like a passer but like a welcome customer. Great attitude! It was ideal for the purpose of our visit. I would reccomend this hotel to my friend and I will deffinetly go back to this hotel if i will have another trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Excellent Customer Service & Very Hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Ali M
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that Kupeli Hotel is probably in the centre of everything. To your left its a 5 mins walk to the Grand Bazaar and to your right again its a 5 mins walk to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque Etc...There wasnt a single time where I had to take the taxi to any of these locations. Customer Service was excellent. Ozgur the receptionist did whatever he could in order to make the stay pleasant. He's probably the best person to get advice on where abouts to go in Istanbul. He wont just tell you every tour is good for the hell of it. Thanks Ozgur. Not to forget the other guys Kamal, and this young guy who i always tend to forget his name. Also there is great restaurant right across with reasonable prices. The price is bit high in my personal opinion but like I said before the location is amazing. Everything is at walking distance, the rooms are bit small but they are clean but eh in all honesty who goes there to sleep all day anyways. I would definately recommend this to all types of travellers. It has a friendly atmosphere, the breakfast is really good, the staff are helpful and also the owner(deniz) is very down to earth type of guy.Since I was a solo traveller, they always suggested the right places to go. I would definately return back to this hotel in the near future. P.S. Love Istanbul and the people. Had an amazing time....Hope to see you guys soon. Ali-Akber

Reviews.Title: “If possible - choose smth else”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana L
Reviews.Content: The receptionists were a bit slow to understand and fullfill our requests, the internet was very slow, the room was small for 2 of us, the heating was very strong for me, but when we opened the window it became too cold. Of course, there was no climate control or a\c. Also, the hotel is very expensive (more then 100 euros per night), a bit dirty. And also, as we noticed, if there are vegetables, olives or other food left after breakfast, they just hide it, and the next day serve the same dish, not even rearranging it or adding smth fresh. As a result one side od the vegetable dish was covered with thick layer of green mould! When I saw it, i immediately lost appetite. Thanks God there were a lot of wonderful cheap places to have breakfast in the city, so we started to skip hotel mouldy breakfasts. Also, the hotel is a bit far from everything, everytime you have to climb up the hill and walk about 2 bus stops to the center of sultanahmet. In general, the city is wonderful, and every day we got so tired and happy that we just dozed off at once, and early in the morning left the hotel again. So i would suggest to take some nice clean hostel instead of this unreasonably expensive place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Niko B
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 12 nights (with a bit of jetting around Turkey/Greece) and had a wonderful experience. Managed to grab a great deal of Expedia, the staff were amazingly friendly with a great local knowledge. The location is actually 5-10 min for the main sights and they offered us a free breakfast when we landed in too early to check in. The only minor issue is that our room had a bit of sound bleed for the neighbouring room, but otherwise everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “kupeli hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2RKI
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel. I liked it a lot. The service was very nice, hospitable and more than satisfactory. Also, I'd like to note that there was a man named Kamal who treated me in the best way possible and me feel like his brother. Of course, I decided to come back to this hotel as soon as I can. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Meral K
Reviews.Content: Very clean, helpful staff, great breakfast, it was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great holidays! Very good hotel with an exceptional staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sema K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a strategical and good place. Near from Sultan Ahmed Mosque, Aya Sofia... It's really clean and the atmosphere is very friendly and funny. The staff is very performant, nice, helpful and really outgoing. It makes us feel good. I recommand this hotel for all travellers! Je conseille cette hÃ´tel Ã  tout les voyageurs. Jâ€™espÃ¨re y re-sÃ©journÃ©e bientÃ´t. De plus, Istanbul est une ville merveilleuse, de par ses monuments et ses diffÃ©rentes architectures, son histoire, ses habitants, ses avenues marchandes et centres commerciaux... Enfin, il est important de souligner qu'il y a un rÃ©el rapport qualitÃ© prix dans cette hÃ´tel. Ã–zgÃ¼r bey, Atilla bey ve Kemel Bey, sizlerden Ã¶zellikle tekrar teÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim. Cok eglenceli ve kayifli vakit geÃ§irdim. Ozellikle hava limanina goturen araci beklerken. Insallah en kisa zamanda yeniden Istanbul'la gelip ve ayni otelde kalmak nasip olur :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic central location”
Reviews.Author: WendyMartin1972
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel and we got a great deal on booking.com. Rooms very clean, staff great, free wifi and rooms nice and warm which was needed in the snowy february weather. Location right near all the main sights but in a bit of a hilly area if mobility is an issue. Great little restaurant opposite - Tanditistambul - authentic, wholesome, good value, turkish food - Yum . Breakfast at hotel plentiful and varied. If I came back to Istanbul would def come to this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “thank you”
Reviews.Author: manoly12
Reviews.Content: dear tourist Iwould like to tell you about this hotle its very near to topkape & blue moeqe & Aua sofa , grand bazer , aksary . lali . & important Trame to go any wear Iwould like to tell Mr. Denaz & Mr, Ozgul & Mr. Jamal becouse they are most frindly you fell in your house ,you make my trip very nice . thank you staff Kupeli hotle thank you

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Oskar_12
Reviews.Content: Excilent service, good location and nice atmosphere in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location for sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Shaz D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the Kupeli Hotel 11th-17th December 2011. Just a short walk to the Grand Bazaar, and local public transport. Staff were excellent, especially Ozgur, and very clean, couldnt fault it all......will definately return for our next trip very soon

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAFF WITH MAHER LEADERSHIP”
Reviews.Author: saiedd
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel with my wife for seven nights 11-18 JAN. 2012. location very good. rooms .breakfast ,and other facilities are very good. but brilliant care of the staff for the guests make us feel so safe and satisfied. . . MAHER was so polite and helpful and he was really "an information center" i toured many countries and slept in many hotels . but the staff in this hotel, with the leadership of maher was one of the best that we met.

Reviews.Title: “Dear Kupeli Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Girl1999
Reviews.Content: I loved the service and it is a clean hotel.The person that i would like to thank is Ozgur and the boss of kupeli hotel aswell i will come and visit use next tim I come to Istanbul Turkey :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikail B
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very nice and the personel are very friendly. The Personel Kemal is a very nice peaple who helps by everything you need. Shisha and Coffee are very fine. :) Das Hotel ist sehr gepflegt und in einem sehr guten Zustand. Das Personal sehr nett und hilfsbereit. Vor allem Kemal ist fÃ¼r alles hilfsbereit zu jeder Uhrzeit. Schischa sollte man auf jeden fall mal ausprobieren. Cok SÃœper bir Hotel cok hosuma gitti.Istanbula tekrar geldigimde yine bu hotele gelirim uygun fiyatlarla ve personel yemek hersey cok sÃ¼perdi. Kemal Bey ve Ã¶bÃ¼r arkadaslardan allah razi olsun. Mikail Aricicek

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay with family/kids”
Reviews.Author: Sabir H
Reviews.Content: We loved the service and friendliness, even before we reahced! Deniz was really helpful in answering our questions via email. The front desk staff, the morning breakfast.staff(especially Kemal) , the cleaning crew everyone was really nice in a genuine way. I would highly recommend this to anyone travelling to Istanbul for sigthseeing as it is located minutes(by walk) from every important place on an Istanbul traveller's list!!Absolutely best value and experience!!

Reviews.Title: “kupeli means earring”
Reviews.Author: EmsworthStella
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week at Easter 2011.. Although our room was tiny, it Very close to the Main Square, the bazaar, all tourist ttractions. Easy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Place from where you near the interrestings things to see.”
Reviews.Author: martinhendriks
Reviews.Content: 10 - 15 min from the Blue Mosque, Bazaar and university. Clean bedding en location, Good beds. A little noisy, du to airco and thin walls. Friendly staff, and everybody like to learn better Englisch. This in a nice way. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Biruta B
Reviews.Content: The hotel would be a good choise for thouse, who likes comfort, tidy rooms, friendly and helpful staff as well as reasenable prices. I and my friends were stade at this hotel 4 days and all of us were realy satisfied. And another thing to mention is that the hotel is situated in Sultan Ahmet, old city's center, which is not far away from cultural monuments of Istambul, the see and Grand Bazar. Especially we would like to express our gratitude to the staff of the hotel for their kidness and care, among of them are: firstly Ozgur Kaya, also Mahir, Emrah and Kemar :) :) Biruta :)

Reviews.Title: “Big Brother Rooms, Good Location & That's it!”
Reviews.Author: IonutBucharest
Reviews.Content: Pros: - location: 10 min walk to blue mosque, university and grand bazaar area (Sultanahmed area); - clean bedding and clean location; - elevator; - friendly staff although starting with the reservation and with the welcoming we were told each time to wait until the English speaking guy will come at concierge to help us with our basic demands; Cons: - no lunch/dinner restaurant; - thin walls through which you hear everything even if you do not want to; actually our room 303 and our neighbors room 304 were part of one apartment which was split by a thin wall through which any little sound could pass; the proof to this is that between the two rooms there is a door which was closed during our stay; anyway this is the first time living in a "Big Brother" kind of hotel where "sharing" by sound means everything but intimacy; - windows couldn't be closed very well and therefore all the noise on the street you can hear inside (remember Istanbul "sleeps" around 02:00 a.m. and awakes 05:00 a.m. of the same day so a good drink and/or a long day walk could help to fall asleep and ignore or the hassle and noise coming from your neighbors and/or street); - no parking place although on the phone it was told us that that will be not a problem; luckily we managed to park the car in front of the hotel (the single parking place available); anyway this goes only to those which dare to drive in Istanbul (I personally enjoy driving around the city and considered it a good driving experience - no rules are applicable other then common sens); - poor breakfast and meat products impossible to digest/eat (be careful); I can not imagine a longer stay then 2-3 days in this hotel with that breakfast "menu" included in the room price; - small rooms and bathroom; - cheep furniture; - dirty walls; - light is flickering and out of 10 bulbs only 3 were operating from time to time; - broken window; - bad maintenance and NO attention to details; All in all the first impression about this hotel is good but afterwards you may discover quickly what a bad choice it was. Anyway it could be worst though! About Sultanahmed area: - food - if you wish international cuisine or a good Turkish lunch/dinner + enjoy the old city be prepared to spend for a main course/person between 21-46 TL (9-20 EURO); a bottle of wine starts from 58 TL (25 EURO); - night out: we choose to enjoy the roof terrace of Pierre Lotti Hotel which is 4 min. away and which will be our next hotel to stay if we will decide to return to Istanbul; the food here was reasonably priced and the atmosphere & music was great; - shopping: Grand/Old Bazaar is an interesting experience; I returned to Istanbul after 10 years and can say the Bazaar is shrinking its offer and sellers are not any more so interested to negotiate in a old fashioned way; they are pretty bored and not very happy to talk as before; Enjoy Turkey! http://www.turkeytravelplanner.com/

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: wahlstrl
Reviews.Content: The general rooms are quite small but comfortable, and the bathrooms are very nice. The location is fairly noisy at times, but Istanbul is a noisy city. in our seven days, it didn't bother us much at all, and we're very tolerant guests when it comes to minor things. The Turkish breakfast is wonderful, and the staff is generous, pleasant, and accomodating. We had reserved a triple. It would have been fine for two adilts and a child, but we were with our 22 year-old daughter. As soon as the clerk realized how inconvenient that would be, he arranged to put us in the suite as soon as it was open. We spent three nights in the small triple and four in the suite. The suite is spacious, comfortable, and nicely decorated. The location was great, especially if you are walkers. We were a few blocks from the tram and halfway between the Blue Mosque/tourist areas and Istanbul University and the Grand Bazaar. And, the price was great. We went to Istanbul to see our daughter, who is studying there, and we weren't sure we would like it. We absolutely loved the city, the people, and the culture. The staff at Hotel Kupeli added a lot to that impression, and We can't wait to go back. Bottom line, If you need five star perfection, this place is not for you, but if you're into comfort, convenience, nice people at a really good price, I recommend Hotel Kupeli.

Reviews.Title: “City Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kamal G
Reviews.Content: The positive side of the hotel is that it is centrally located with 10 minutes walk to all the popular places, like Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc. and the hotel staff is very helpful. During our stay, we had one person at the front desk, named Ozeguer. He was very friendly and willing to help. But the negative side is that the breakfast was very basic and the fruit and vegetable trays were not refreshed each mornings. You can tell that the trays are repeated for many days in a row which is not hygenie. The rooms are not sound proof as you can hear outside noise and people walking on your floor.

Reviews.Title: “1 week heaven”
Reviews.Author: Atesundjasmin
Reviews.Content: we have been there for 1 week on 25.of october 2011, and from the beginning on mr. mahir was helping uns so friendly in all kind of questions. on our first breakfast we met mr. kemal and he is such a friendly man.he is giving you more than you want. they have a realy wonderfull breakfest and they all try to help you in all questions. our room was very clean. they are a little bit noisi but for what you get its perfect. and when you will meet young mr.emrah, you will know that he also runns for you too get what you need. It is a beautiful little 3 star hotel which is very competent of ringing out at the front PS: we will be there soon again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: MaxineChehab
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Istanbul and we stayed in Kupeli hotel because of the location and reviews we had read about it. It was nothing short of AMAZING. The location in the old city is perfect. It is walking distance from the Grand Bazaar and all of the attractions located in the old city of Istanbul. The staff (Mahir and Ozgur and others) were very friendly and understood English and helped us figuring out where to go in our free time and with the transportation. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean and tidy and they have a typical turkish style which is very sweet. The breakfast buffet is very generous, you can find anything you are craving for as a breakfast. This hotel is really recommended. It is perfect in all ways.

Reviews.Title: “A Find in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Susan260
Reviews.Content: With many hotels to choose from in Istanbul, our party of nine booked into Hotel Kupeli based on a good review in the New York Times. For us, this was a find, a small, reasonably priced hotel in a great location within walking distance of many of the famous sites in the city. Rooms, except for the large suite, are average in size, but perfectly adequate and clean. The breakfast buffet, on the terrace or in the adjoining breakfast room, was very good with a variety of foods. It was a most pleasant way to start the day. We found the staff to be friendly and accommodating. A room assigned to three women in our party was far too small so they were moved into a suite at no extra cost. Our request for a later check out was granted, and taxis were promptly called to take us to the airport. At all times, the staff greeted us with a smile. The one negative...we were not met at the airport as promised. We finally booked our own van from the airport to the hotel. We stayed in Istanbul for four nights and because of our very positive experience, would happily stay at Hotel Kupeli again. For an excellent lunch or dinner, try Restaurant Vuslat which is a short walk from the hotel. You will have delicious, authentic food in a relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Abbas F
Reviews.Content: I have been in Istanbul for 3 days and must say that I had very excellent stay at hotel Kupeli would to draw attention about the hotel have very kindly and helpfull staff especially Mr. Kamal who is a very kindly person never tired for his client and work very hard every day from 18:00 to 8:00. also at reception Mr. Ã–ZGÃœL very good person and funny he say this frase " Are you drinking Pepsi , You are very Sexy, Uno dous Tres NEVER STRESS" I warmed recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: Taheer W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice! ... the location is also very great and it right near the tramp(train station).. the service was great! if you called the room service there would be there within a minute with what you asked for!.. the people were also very friendly and help full!.. if i were ever to travel to istanbul again i wo!uld defiantly stay at this hotel again- Taheer :)

Reviews.Title: “Well located and fair price”
Reviews.Author: FÃ¡bio O
Reviews.Content: Well located, close to the main points to be visited. cozy and helpful staff, especially receptionist Yigit Mahir, who was very attentive not only the hotel but the indications of the city. English fluently and easily approachable.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Catarina M
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent infrastructure, good price and good management We had a great service for the Mr. Mahyr. Once we arrived in Brazil pointed out to our friends. Congratulations to the Hotel Kupeli team.

Reviews.Title: “An unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Florin_mch
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul three days, two nights at this hotel and do not recommend this location to anyone of the following reasons: 1. correspondence by email with Deniz, the hotel manager, to my question if offers parking told me that yes, when I arrived at the reception told me that they have free parking (it is true that in front of the hotel have than parking for 2 cars only). 2.M sent to a parking lot where we paid 5 euros / day parking in last night knowing that I had to spend the Kupeli Hotel had to leave at 3 am I had to walk 700 km to Didim. 3.A whole affair until I was able to retrieve my car from parking last night at around 22. 4.In mail I asked for breakfast on account not serve him that day left the hotel at 3 am, to make me some sandwiches road, and assured me that they solve Nu assured me sandwiches any road and I have received the same money and get breakfast and parking. 6.Rooms-extremely small, have no way to get natural light or ventilation, are lacking windows. 7.Cei claustrophobia not to make mistakes to be accommodated in this hotel. 8.racitoarele of the 3 rooms that we had not worked. This hotel 9.Not recommend anyone with a very poor management and very poor breakfast

Reviews.Title: “I would certainly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: castrod78702
Reviews.Content: I couldnâ€™t of have picked a better place to use as a home away from home; cozy, interesting & colorful hotel in Sultanahmet (old city area) on Emin Sinan, Hamam Sk. What a welcome I received by the personnel â€“ they were very friendly, helpful and polite and had a great sense of humor â€“ â€œcome on bebÃ©â€�. Perfect location - near Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia Little, Hagia Sophia, the archaeological museum, the tram, covered Bazaar and other attractions. The room was small (as expected from the website) - comfortable and clean â€“ fresh sheets everyday. Breakfast included - was a selection of breads, meats, cheeses, fruits and yoghurt which was fine (on the 6th floor terrace). Great coffee! Spent a month in Turkey and traveled around eastern and central part of the country. When in Istanbul, I always came back to Kupeli Hotel between outings. I strongly recommend this hotel if ever in Istanbul â€“ great people â€“ great price. Many thanks to Ã–zgÃ¼r, Aykut, Akif, Soner and Mahir for all your help and making my trip to Turkey even better.

Reviews.Title: “A LOVELY FRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MRSTOFFS
Reviews.Content: We arrived during renovation, so it got better each day! Everyone was so friendly, the staff could not do enough for you, even when I forgot some important tablets, the reception staff organised for a friend to take me to a chemist nearby and translate what I wanted. The rooms were clean, the breakfast suited everyone's tastes. There will be teething problems but the staff need to know what they are to address them. it's a big change from what we expected on the picutre of the old hotel on the internet. Plus you get to step out into a film set right outside the front door - Coronation Street in Istanbul! Don't miss out on Cozy Pub/Restaurant either - they have a spectacular rooftop restaurant.... We will return! Alan, Michele, Josh and Tom Finch

Reviews.Title: “No-go”
Reviews.Author: MariaTarasova
Reviews.Content: The hotel pretends to be 4 star, I would say it's 2! The service was just horrible-horrible! First of all the blow dryer was sparking, we asked to have it replaced or fixed and got the promise from the receptionist that it will be done next day. As we returned back to the room next day in the afternoon we found out the broken death-carrying blow dryer was still there. The receptionist told us angrily that it was Sunday and there was not much he could do. So why saying they would take care of it in the first place?! They ended up giving us a very old portable blow dryer. Next thing: the towel ring. It was broken as we moved in and never got fixed either so we had to keep hand towel on the sink. More: the cleaning lady was not cleaning but rearranging out private items in the way it seemed convenient to her, e.i. I found my flip flops in bedside table and our cosmetic items were all mixed as if she tried it! Very poor breakfast with undrinkable tea and coffee has to be mentioned as well. Last note - the room itself was a doll house size

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sonja19
Reviews.Content: Nice & cozy hotel, rooms are small but very clean. Bathroom is also nice and clean. The staff is very friendly, polite and helpful. It is easy to communicate in English. We had a great time at Kupeli hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: magrat7
Reviews.Content: We booked through lastminute.com and got a great deal on a triple room. When we arrived at the hotel the room was still being cleaned but the staff were ver y welcoming and offered us drinks while we waited. Being a triple room it was a little bit crowded, but it was spotlessly clean and the bathroom was also very nice with a great shower. The room had good air condtioning which was very welcome, and still water from the minibar was free. Breakfast was a selection of bread, meats, cheeses, fruits and yoghurt which was fine, and there was a view of the Sea of Marmara from the restaurant terrace. This hotel is conveniently located about 5 mins walk from the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar, and 2 minutes from a tram station on the T1 Line so it was really easy to get around. We really enjoyed our stay in Istanbul. All the staff at Hotel Kupeli were very friendly and helpful, which made the trip even better.

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable management and staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelermons
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Kupeli for one night before joining our organised tour from the US. The pictures on the net (tripadvisor and hotel website) reflect what you'll get. Basic hotel for a great price. Clean and comfortable. 5 minutes from tram station. Easy transfer from International airport. Within 5-10 minutes of Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar etc. (Don't expect views of these sites from the hotel but that's really not so important.) As 2 young females traveling alone, we felt very safe and comfortable. The staff went the extra mile to make us feel like home away from home. For a one night stay, we were impressed that the manager called to welcome us, remembered our names, checked in with us to make sure everything was ok with us and helped in more ways than we ever expected. The hospitality at this hotel made all the difference. Thank you Deniz!

Reviews.Title: “lovely kupeli”
Reviews.Author: yerbamate
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the kupeli and i was told that the management was changed and they are going to change some thing,improve others.i suggested them to make some nonsmoking floors , make the windows sound proof and change the curtains.the rest??all is great!very good location,in the middle of action,the lively area of sultan ahmed,a few minutes walk to the grand bazaar,the blue mosque,topkapi,the sea,and so many restaurants with traditional food just2 minutes walk ,on gedik pasa street. breakfast was simple and nice.rooms are clean,small and cozy.white linens and towels. i will comeback. thank you very much for your hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “I higly recommend !! :-)”
Reviews.Author: LucyPac
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT PLACE AND STAFF!!! Perfect location! ( near Blue Mosque and in 3 min walking distance from tram station - easy to get everywhere) The personnel were VERY friendly, helpful and polite and had a good sense of humor;-)) The hotel has the new owner since few weeks and he really improves the standard. The room we had was comfortable and clean. And the breakfast served was very good indeed .. on the tarras!!... :-) I would like to be there now.. A ! there is a small restaurant opposite the hotel. They serve good, fresh meals:-) I WILL CERTAINLY STAY THERE AGAIN!! Lucy

Reviews.Title: “New owner/new management - new Drive”
Reviews.Author: Hrztrave
Reviews.Content: Well situated, cozy Hotel in interesting & colourful Sultanahmet-area. New, young and helpful staff to serve You.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: JannekePijnenborg
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend had a really wonderful stay at Hotel Kupeli! I recommend this hotel to everyone who is visiting Istanbul. Why? 1) Very good price/quality! 2) Very good service! The hotel has a new owner and new management since last week and I only can tell that they are very helpfull and kind. We couldn't ask for more! Deniz, thanks!! 3) Very clean! The new owner has rebuild a lot of things. A new shower en new curtains. And everyday you get fresh towels and your room is cleaned. 4) Location couldn't be better. All sightseeing is by 5 minutes walking. Superb! Only good words from me and my friend for this Hotel, truely.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay at the hotel very much”
Reviews.Author: Natalieski
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is great - it is so close to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia! Breakfasts on the roof are very romantic- you can see the entire city when sun is rising! I enjoyed my stay at the hotel very much

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with perfect location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kmehmet
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with really good location (you're at 2 min walking from the grand bazar or the blue mosque). The tramway station is located 50 meter from the hotel. If you can found availability in this hotel for your trip --> Don't miss it :)

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQSSS
Reviews.Content: This place looked modern and swanky on the website, however was anything BUT. Location is good - walking distance to all of the main attractions, however as a group of 4 females, we did not feel safe in this hotel. The doors to the rooms did not lock appropriately. Rooms were dirty and ill-kept, with hairs on the sheets, multiple burned out light bulbs, windows over the street that did not close, and draperies half falling down. There were no safes in the rooms, only at the front desk. Our "view" from one room was of a brick wall with a flower spray painted on it. When we complained to the front desk, we got a lot of run around about an unavailable, then suddenly available suite, which we ultimately checked out, and thouh it was much better, we were still not impressed. We were looking for basic, clean and safe accomodations, and felt this place used false advertising and was not worth the price. We cancelled our rooms and moved elsewhere, then dealt with the travel agency who recommended it to get back a partial refund (europeandestinations, com - would never use them again, as they recommended this place, multiple tour rip-offs, and were not helpful when we had issues with travel plan changes due to union strikes). Istanbul was wonderful. Kupeli was NOT.

Reviews.Title: “its comfy and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kimidoll
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend spent 3 nights in this hotel and we had no problems. our room is clean, breakfast are very basic here but not bad. its also close to major attractions in Istanbul, it was cold when we went there so its really nice to walk around and there's a lot of good restuarants to dine or drink nearby. i would recommend this for those who wants to enjoy the city more than their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “DISSAPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: MAECorkIreland
Reviews.Content: When we entered our room one part of heavy curtain was was not fully connected to curtain rail and the other half was in the drawer! Told person at reception could they fix it,also hair dryer not working, and the lift have a mind of itsown, nothing was done,staff were not friendly, we were not happy with service. What is good about this Hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: mosaloca
Reviews.Content: I learned about Hotel Kupeli in New York Times' traveler review and decided to make a reservation. I did an initial inquiry by e-mail and didn't get a response; a second e-mail did get a response and things went smoothly after that. The hotel was built in 2007 so everything is refreshingly new and clean. Our room was bright and cozy. However, I can't imagine it's going to stay that way for long -- things clearly aren't maintained very well. Two doorknobs in our room kept detaching, the main drain in our bathroom was covered in mildew, and light-bulbs were burnt out and not replaced. The computer in the lobby was free for guest use, but the Internet connection was constantly going down. Also, the main front desk clerk was impatient and irritable all the time... though I can't really blame him, considering he was at the desk about 20 hours/day. Overall we enjoyed our experience at Kupeli and don't regret our stay. Breakfast on the terrace was especially lovely.

Reviews.Title: “do not trust the NY times article...”
Reviews.Author: denaliboy
Reviews.Content: we also felt duped by seth sherwood's "save or splurge: istanbul" article in the NY times (august 2009). kupeli was just another blah hotel with no character. granted, the rooms were clean, and the flat screen TV was kind of cool, but when in istanbul, i had no plans to spend my time in the hotel room, watching TV. service was OK. there was nobody in the breakfast area to help with the food, and when the internet wasn't working, the front desk staff was of no use. we paid 65 euro/night for three nights, and we ultimately moved to a different hotel (the side) which charged less (50 euro/night) and was closer to the sites in sultanahmet such as the blue mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: FedeSiria
Reviews.Content: Quite a good hotel if you consider that in Istanbul hotel prices are higher than the rest of Turkey. The room was a bit small, the sink was broken and the WC was leaking at every flush. Breakfast in the average, the hotel and the rooms very clean and the staff was really helpful. The free parking available was an essential facility for us, since we left the car in their garage for 5 days! Good location, near the major cultural attractions, and a few metres from the Cemberlitas tram stop. BUT if you're more interested in nightlife (clubs, pubs, restaurants and shopping) maybe Taksim square would be a better option to stay. Even because the tramway and the tunnel close before midnight and then you have to take a taxi (20 - 25 TL) or walk to go back to Sultanahmet (30-40 minutes walk).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if at all possible”
Reviews.Author: IHeartMacarons
Reviews.Content: We were mislead to this tourist trap by an August 2009 "Save or Splurge" travel article in the New York Times. The rooms are ridiculously small and some of them have no view outside (and therefore no natural light). If you have any problem, the management will remain completely oblivious. The bath tub in our room sprung a leak during our stay (with an ensuing flood after each shower) but this was not rectified nor acknowledged by the staff. The breakfast is adequate, and the location is great, but these are not enough to make up for your uncomfortable stay The only redeeming thing about this hotel is the lovable day porter - Akif.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel, Disappointing Management”
Reviews.Author: Bebek_Sinan
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 3 seasoned travellers who stayed at this hotel for a little over a week during the month of May, 2010. We picked this hotel based on a NY times article that featured Istanbul. Almost immediately the hotel began to show problems. Though we had arranged for the promised free pick up from the airport, we were not met at the airport and had to take a taxicab to the hotel. Upon arrival, not only were we not compensated for the 40 lira cab ride, we also were told that we had not given them flight details, which was sent to the hotel 3 times for confirmation. We were placed in a very small room (15 feet by 9 feet) that could barely hold our luggage. This would have been fine had the room not cost us 80 euros a night. Upon complaining we were told that we could transfer to a much bigger room in a couple of days, which to the hotel's credit was honoured 2 days later when we were placed in the Fuat Bey suite, the hotel's largest at the same rate. Even this room was replete with problems. While the size of the room and the service was adequate, the bathroom had an annoying tendency to start flooding for no apparent reason. We had to keep on devising engineering techniques with our towels to make dams to keep the water controlled, and though this was brought to the hotels attention nothing was done about it. The TV also was placed in a very unstable LCD device holder that threatened to fall apart if you moved it to a viewable angle from the sofa. We left the hotel for a few days as we visited Bodrum, and we did get a transfer to the airport. However, upon our immediate return we again were not picked up from the airport, and had to spend more of our money to get a free service. Upon arrival, the hotel not only did not apologize for this, but tried to pin blame on another company. It seemed to us that the hotel manager (Osman) could not care any less with any of our problems and actually ended up arguing with one of our colleagues regarding compensation for this comedy of errors. It struck me as rather unprofessional and certainly did not strengthen our confidence in the hotel's ability to hold up to its basic duty to ensure that our stay was accomodated with at least some sympathy. His solution to our problems? A 20 euro discount on our last night, which was in a small room again as the big suite was no longer available. No apologies, and no attempt to compensate further was made. The only positive note was the very helpful Akif and the night porter, which was truly the only highlight of the stay. Breakfast was standard Turkish fare and was adequate. The location was very good, and close to Cemberlitas Tram stop. We would highly caution travellers who may have picked this hotel based on that very misleading NY times article.

Reviews.Title: “A super little hotel at 50 Euros, a tourist trap at 70.”
Reviews.Author: dyonysios
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and neat and staff are very friendly and polite. But lack of facilities, small rooms, poor sound insulation and less than picturesque location means that it is quite conclusively outclassed by many other local hotels at this price (70 Euros in our case). 20 Euros less however and this would have been another 5 star review.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Central Hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: DaffySouthampton
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my husband and I had booked a hotel abroad independantly and from the start this hotel gave me valued information. We are in our late 50's. The service was exceptional and the attitude of the staff was something to be proud of. They picked us up from the airport and as we were spending the central part of our holiday in the south of the country, they helped us trace our overnight coach travel tickets and locate the coach station. The driver took exceptional care of us when arriving at the coach station, ensuring that we were at the correct place booking us in and what we should do. This was the night of the floods in Instanbul and his help was invaluable. Likewise he picked us up on our return to the hotel, and took us to the airport for our flight home on what was a public holiday, Otherwise it would have been difficult to find transport. We thank him for putting himself out for these visitors to Turkey On arrival we did have rather a lot of luggage so the hotel gave us an upgrade to a suite, "Fat Buey". This was an extremely spacious room with jacuzzi bath, 3pce suite and ample storage. It was spotlessly clean and the towels were replenished every day. We were at the front of the hotel and quite close to the Blue Mosque, but we were not disburbed by any street noise. On our return to the hotel 10 days later we expected to be situated in a considerably smaller double room but were pleasantly surprised to be placed back in the large suite. For a longer stay the suite rooms would be extremely comfortable. The 7' wide bed was an unexpected surprise but very comfortable. Breakfast was a simple but filling Turkish fare with decent tea!!! thank you. Coffee wasn't bad either. This was a hotel that was homely in nature but tastefully decorated and very clean, The web site pictures reflected the interior well. The smallest downside was the roof terrace breakfast room. The view of the Marmaris see is a little distant and the plants looked a little in need of some water. On the first point we were not disappointed as this is the old part of the city and it was refreshing to see a lovely hotel sited so close to the sites. And if you go up Galata Tower you would see that most of the hotels are situated in these quaint little streets. This is the beauty of old Istanbul. The hotel staff helped us locate the public transport and gave us the opening and closing times of the various tourist attractions, particularly useful, as this was close to the end of Ramadam. We used the trams to get us arround without any problems. Our stay would not have been so pleasant without this service. A very big thank you we hope to return again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel for a True Explorer”
Reviews.Author: newyorklovesistanbul
Reviews.Content: I learned about Hotel Kupeli through The New York Times: http://travel.nytimes.com/2009/08/16/travel/16save.html What a perfect hotel to park my bags, grab breakfast, and walk into the all the action of Sultanahmet with a 3 minute walk! The staff is truly Turkish in its excellent hospitality and consideration. The rooms are neat and clean, spacious, replete with the amenities of pretty bathrooms and showers, plasma tvs, air conditioning, etc. The furniture is new and maintained well, the elevator is artsy, and the facilities great. I go to Istanbul every summer and I think a true explorer of Turkish culture would want a clean, safe, hospitable spot to park luggage and to sleep at night, while living up the city during every waking moment. I didn't need nargileh/hookahs delivered to my room or other room service or lush carpets -- I wanted to explore Istanbul and take in its sights, sounds, and culture while I was out and about, not from a hotel room. Hotel Kupeli offers just the right amenities for a true explorer. The icing on the cake is the fantastic staff, from Umit - the General Manager - to Baris (lead manager), Kadir, Bekir, and Mustafa. Mehmet makes a light breakfast on the 6th floor every day. Frat (whom I am convinced used to be a professional driver) will take you to and from anywhere you'd like. They are all ever-helpful and eager to make each guest's stay special and filled with treasures of experiences. I can't wait to go back! Thank you, Hotel Kupeli!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: zvd
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is centrally located in old istanbul without being right in the center of the noise and traffic that usually accompanies such a strategic location. The rooms were no-frills but were clean and comfortable with good hot water in the bathrooms. THe staff were wonderful and held on to one of our bags while we toured the rest of Turkey for a week. After we got back from touring the country, they happily moved us to a larger room when the one we were given proved a little crowded with all our luggage. The breakfast was simple but very good (though there was no hot food). All in all a good hotel for being in the heart of things. (Not very sure of room rates as we were booked through a tour company) but if we go back I will gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A well-located, comfortable, moderate-budget hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: svar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a few blocks off the main tourist street of Sultanahmet, about a ten to fifteen minute walk from the tram station, with several small shops close by and a good, small restaurant located at the corner. The staff is efficient and helpful, especially the two receptionists Kader and Baresh, who speak fluent English. The rooms are a good size and are well-designed and comfortable. The internet connection does not work well in the rooms and you have to take your computer to the lobby, where the connection is good. The bathrooms are modern and functional. There is pleanty of hot water and the air conditioning in the rooms works well. The breakfast is good and is served on the top floor. The lift is a bit slow but is very handy for transporting large pieces of luggage. This is a relatievely new hotel, about one or two years old. We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled service”
Reviews.Author: JameelM
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were truly the most helpful and kind I have ever come across, after having visited dozens of hotels in the past. They were kind, sincere, helpful, intelligent, and very good english speakers, and the breakfast included a nice assortment. Free internet, but I could not get a good wireless connection on the 4th floor, but was excellent on the lobby. I would gladly return to this hotel in the future, and wish they accepted my tip! Jameel

Reviews.Title: “Still maintaining a very good standard”
Reviews.Author: mosiesmate
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay endorses most of the comments made previously. The hotel is quiet, clean, well presented and well run. The staff are very friendly, helpful and speak English to a good/excellent standard. The room I stayed in was over the front of the hotel and was surprisingly quiet considering the proximity to the major sights and the daytime traffic in even the smallest roads in Istanbul. I will definitely stay again and recommend it to anyone on a budget . One minor detraction was the lack of a sink plug, but as this is common through out Turkey and Greece you are best off taking your own universal plug.

Reviews.Title: “"Low price - low quality" does not apply to Kupeli”
Reviews.Author: RufatAbas
Reviews.Content: This was my sixth or seventh trip to Istanbul and every time I was staying in different hotels. This time I have decided to make an online reservation in Kupeli hotel mainly because of a good combination of price and location. This is a small hotel with clean rooms, good service and very kind, professional and friendly personnel. "Low price - low quality" does not apply to this hotel. For affordable price you will enjoy your time in Kupeli. Do not forget to ask the receptionists to arrange boat trips city tours for you. This is something you will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and more...”
Reviews.Author: RachCalgaryCanada
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kupeli is the first hotel I stayed in when I arrived in Turkey and it was a great way to start. The location is excellent and the rooms are very clean. The staff is what makes you want to return to this hotel. The service we received from the staff is much better than I have seen at most 5 star hotels in my previous travels. They are willing to go the extra step to make your stay memorable. (One of the staff members even offered to get me some medication at the store since I wasn't feeling well....I've never had that service before.. ) I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place with high level of Sevice”
Reviews.Author: rosivdapirt1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Kupeli hotel with my family . We had a fairly big suite with very clean and nice Bathroom & Spa. Suite had a big flat Screen TV which you could easily adjust it to different sides. The location of the hotel was excellent and it was just a stone through to the Central Sultan Ahmet area where you can find lot of shops and restaurants and tourist attractions. The staff were exteremly friendly and helpful and welcoming. Hotel's manager was a professional man with high level of english and i found him very concerned about the comfortability of the guests in the hotel. Price wise, the hotel was really good value for money compared to the other hotels that i inspected or found on the internet. I would defenitely consider getting this hotel if i travel to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Nadia25
Reviews.Content: Kupeli hotel is a small hotel, very clean and very well located. You can walk to all the major tourist attraction (Sainte-Sophie, Blue Mosque). What is special about Kupeli is the people working there!!! They speak good english and are always there to help with anything you need. The people at the reception are fantastic (especially Ibrahim who will make you feel like home). I strongly recomment Kupeli hotel and you will probably fall in love with the turquish people, If one day I have the chance to go back in Istanbul (unfortunatly it is far from Canada) I will certainly stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding performance by new hotel Kupeli”
Reviews.Author: Masterscan
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Istanbul on a whim, without any prior planning. I took a cab, asking the driver to take me to a hotel near the city center, I would never recommend asking a cab to take you to a hotel, in all the countries I have traveled the quality of the cabs varies. The cab driver took me to this older hotel, in poor condition. The deal they were offering wasn't satisfactory, the amount they were charging was not worth the stay. I then decided to go for an evening stroll, thats when I came across the brand new hotel Kupeli. Immediately I noticed a major difference, the staff was clean, helpful and willing do negotiate a fair price. Given that it was a brand new hotel, the rates were very reasonable. The rooms were immaculate, a nice single room was perfect for my solo travels. The bathrooms were spectacular and the breakfast was awakening. To anyone traveling to Istanbul I recommend the Hotel Kupeli, it made my experience wonderful. I also would like to send a shout out to Ibrahim Susam, when I arrived to the hotel he was willing to take time away from his manager duties to walk me around, get me settled and provide the comfort any good hotel should aspire to. Grant

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Great location= Fantastic time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KKOakville
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kupeli hotel from April 30 until May 4, 2009. You can't beat the price and location of the hotel, but what really stood out was the service. I have never felt so welcome and we were always greated with a smile. Everyone was more than willing to go out of their way to ensure our trip lived up to our expectations. I honestly don't think I would have enjoyed my trip to Istanbul without the staff at the Kupeli (particularily Ibrahim, who is polite, knowledgable and extremely accomodating) I would recommend Hotel Kupeli to everyone and anyone and have already! I plan on returning in the fall to Istanbul and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My vacantion”
Reviews.Author: dragoswooow
Reviews.Content: I have been to hotel Kupeli in 21th-26th april 2009.The hotel is very close to some turkish baths,to Cemberlitas train station,the great bazar,the blue mosque and haghia sofia.The stuff from the hotel is very nice,they speak english and turkish(one of receptioners knows some spanish i guess).They will give you brochures to very good restaurants,trips to prince's island,bosphorus and golden horn,and some traditional turkish things:baths,traditional dance and belly dance.They also give you some maps and some informations about istanbul.I recommend you this hotel. Chivulescu Dragos,from Romania.

HotelInfo.Name: Kupeli Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hamam Cad. 4 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
